pages.title: Beam Reflector
pages.text: The <item>Beam Reflector/$ is the normal way to move <thing>$(l:intro/beam)beams/$ around. They accept <thing>$(l:intro/beam)beams/$ in any side, and shoot them out the front.$(br2)It should be noted that <thing>$(l:intro/beam)beams/$ move one way only- they go from->to; unlike <thing>$(l:intro/heat)heat/$ or <thing>$(l:intro/rotary)rotary/$ power which are shared over a network.$(br2)

If multiple <thing>$(l:intro/beam)beams/$ are going into the same <item>reflector/$ at once, they will be combined for the output. All <thing>$(l:intro/beam)beams/$ are emitted with a 4 tick (fifth second) delay, as usual.$(br2)Loops of <item>beam reflectors/$ are totally legal, and are pretty good way to store beams losslessly.$(br2)
